instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message:
Hello,

I have an A1398 that came in for thermal mass replacement. However, after the thermal mass application, the mac starts at full fan speed and gets a bit laggy (the cursor freezes a lot and it seams to be running very slowly).

Do you have any idea about what it can be? I'm pretty sure that i haven't knoked out any components...

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message:
Try first disconnecting webcam.
If still the same, test with known good trackpad board/flex.

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message:
Hi,

With the webcam disconnected, it works in a normal way. Is there anything that I can check on the board?

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message:
You can isolate ALS lines from the webcam connector.
Cut off their lines, if no resistor/coil placed in series.

If you don't care about webcam, just leave it disconnected.

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message:
Hi, again...
After all, it seams that the problem isen't on the webcam only. The webcam isen't working, but after a few days the problem has returned. Full fan speed and very slow mac.
I'm waiting for a trackpad flex to arrive. Is there any other tests that i can make, while waiting?
Tks.

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message:
Is the webcam disconnected now?

What is the 820-xxxx code of you board?
Remember to start new threads posting it...

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message:
Hi,
Sorry about the new thread.
The webcam is disconnected and the board is an 820-00246-A.
I already tried with a new trackpad (same cable), but same result. I'm waiting for a new trackpad cable

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message:
You can also try disconnecting RIO board.

BTW, is your board 00426 instead?

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message:
The RIO board is disconnected and it is  a 00426-A board...

I'm not sure if this behavier is normal, but on the benck PSU, it starts consuming 2.38 A (powered off), and when it powers on, it reaches 4.3 amp

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message: Is that current consumtion with battery connected???

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message: Yes, both consumes with battery connected, and with two different batteries.

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message:
Then what's the problem?
Did you check the consume in off state without battery?

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message:
I' thought that the consume with battery was a bit high.

Without battery is OK (0 Amp in off state)

threads.title: A1398 full fan speed and laggy
threads.message: The consume depends by actual battery charge state.
